intro: Lescaillea, commonly known as the golden bellflower, is a genus of flowering plants in the Campanulaceae family. It is characterized by its showy, bell-shaped flowers that typically range in color from yellow to orange. These plants are native to various regions in the Americas, particularly in South America. Lescaillea species often thrive in moist, well-drained soils and prefer partial to full sunlight. They are valued in horticulture for their ornamental appeal and ease of cultivation.
